translation.en: [narrator] On July 10th, 1943,
a unit from Oklahoma,
composed of Mexican-Americans, Native Americans and Dust Bowl cowboys,
translation.de: zusammengesetzt aus Mexikanern, amerikanischen Ureinwohnern und Cowboys,

translation.en: most of whom couldn't drink together in the same bars back home,
translation.de: die in ihrer Heimat nicht dieselben Bars betreten durften,

translation.en: landed in Sicily and began a brutal 500-day trek through Nazi-occupied Europe.
translation.de: landete in Sizilien. 500 Tage lang zogen sie durch das von den Nazis besetzte Europa.

translation.en: This is the story of those men.
translation.de: Dies ist die Geschichte dieser Männer,

translation.en: A group of soldiers known…
translation.de: einer Gruppe von Soldaten, bekannt als...

translation.en: as the Thunderbirds.
How the hell can Coldfoot see anything? I can't even see my fuckin' boots.
translation.de: Kann Coldfoot etwas sehen? Ich sehe nicht mal meine Stiefel.

translation.en: -What's he lookin' at? -He's looking at the fog.
The fog? What the fuck does that mean? We can all see the fog.
translation.de: Wozu, verdammt? Den Nebel sehen wir alle.

translation.en: Shut up, Spigs.
Just make sure you can see him. Yes, sir, Captain.
translation.de: -Behalten Sie ihn nur im Auge. -Jawohl, Captain.

translation.en: -[soldier] Get down! -[gunfire]
-Spigs, get down! -I'm tryin'! Ah! Shit! I'm hit. Fuck!
translation.de: Spigs, runter! Scheiße! Ich bin getroffen!

translation.en: Oh, fuck.
Two Panzers, four platoons of infantry, 500 yards ahead.
translation.de: Zwei Panzer, vier Infanteriezüge, 500 Meter voraus.

translation.en: Fall back to that ridge.
E Company, fall back!
Incoming coordinates. -2-6… -[shouting continues]
Nagles, shut up!
All right. Let's go, Nagles, come on!
No, no, no! Don't go under the trees. Stay out in the open!
translation.de: Nicht unter die Bäume! Bleibt im Freien!

translation.en: Thanks, Cap.
Garcia, Rosa, check out that barn.
translation.de: Garcia, Rosa. Sichern Sie die Scheune.

translation.en: They fell back two miles south and they're still moving.
translation.de: Sie sind noch auf dem Rückzug.

translation.en: What's our damage? Six dead or missing. At least ten wounded.
I wanna know where the Germans are sleeping tonight.
translation.de: Ich will wissen, wo die Deutschen schlafen.

translation.en: Look out for booby traps.
Watch your feet.
Shit! What was that?
A rat?
Nah, man. Too big.
Must be a dog.
He was hiding in the barn, sir. He won't shut up.
translation.de: Er versteckte sich in der Scheune.

translation.en: We need Spigs to tell us what the hell he's saying.
Found this in his hiding place.
translation.de: Ich fand das in seinem Versteck.

translation.en: [in Italian] Give me it. Give me it. Give me it. Give me it.
All right, get him inside. Get some food in him.
translation.de: Geben Sie ihm was zu essen.

translation.en: Where the hell is Spigs?
[man] Spigliani. -[in Italian] Do you speak Italian? -Yes.
-[slowly] Charlestown, Massachusetts. -[Spigs chuckles]
Yes.
-[in English] But you know Boston? -Mh-hmm.
[in Italian] Yes.
[in English] Boston.
[in Boston accent] Park the car in Harvard Yard.
Where did you learn to swim, Private Spigliani?
[Spigs] Fuck.
-Swim? -No, let me guess.
The boys' club on 2nd Street.
translation.de: Im Boys Club in der 2nd Street.

translation.en: Yeah.
How the hell do you know that?
I told you.
I was a graduate student at MIT.
I lived on Maple, near the intersection of 4th.
translation.de: Ich wohnte in der Maple Street, Ecke 4th Avenue.

translation.en: And I dated a girl… named Hammel…
translation.de: Ich hatte eine Freundin namens Hammel.

translation.en: She had these… beautiful breasts.
Sparky Hammel's sister, yeah.
[laughing] Damn!
You and me in Charlestown at the boys' club.
translation.de: Sie und ich in Charlestown im Boys Club.

translation.en: -It's a small world, isn't it? -You can say that again.
Kawacatoose.
Indians and Mexicans
and a wop from Boston?
Yeah. 157th Regiment from Oklahoma.
I got attached at Salerno as an interpreter.
translation.de: Ich wurde in Salerno als Dolmetscher zugewiesen.

translation.en: And their leader, he is an Indian, too?
translation.de: Ist ihr Anführer auch ein Indianer?

translation.en: Capt. Sparks? No.
He's a cowboy. From Arizona.
translation.de: Er ist ein Cowboy aus Arizona.

translation.en: Things must be getting desperate in America
if they're allowing these types into your army.
translation.de: solche Typen in die Armee zu lassen.

translation.en: Red men and Mexicans. Inferior races.
We don't see 'em that way.
They're Americans.
Like me.
Really?
I've been to Oklahoma, Corporal,
and the bars have signs out front that say…
"No Indians Allowed. No Mexicans."
I've also been to Georgia.
They make their Negroes there drink from separate water fountains.
translation.de: Die Neger trinken dort aus getrennten Wasserspendern.

translation.en: So don't tell me they're Americans just like you.
translation.de: Es sind also keine Amerikaner wie Sie.

translation.en: Strange.
To fight for a country where you can't even enjoy a beer…
translation.de: Sie kämpfen für ein Land, in dem sie nicht mal ein Bier

translation.en: at the same bar as your fellow soldier.
So… please now tell me about the ponds.
translation.de: Und nun erzählen Sie mir von den Tümpeln.

translation.en: Ponds?
Yes, I need to know what you did about the ponds.
translation.de: Ja. Was haben Sie mit den Tümpeln gemacht?

translation.en: What ponds? I don't know what the hell you're talking about.
translation.de: Was für Tümpel? Was meinen Sie?

translation.en: -Jesus Christ! -Ponds!
-What did you do with the ponds! -We didn't see any fucking ponds.
translation.de: -Was ist mit den Tümpeln? -Da waren keine.

translation.en: -You're lying! -Jesus Christ, I'm telling you the truth.
Your company crossed three ponds in two days.
Here, here and here.
What are the conditions of those ponds?
translation.de: In welchem Zustand sind die Tümpel?

translation.en: Ponte. Br-- Bridges. You're talking about bridges.
Yes.
Bridges.
I used the Italian word, didn't I?
My mistake.
Jesus Christ.
What are the conditions of those bridges?
translation.de: In welchem Zustand sind die Brücken?

translation.en: We didn't touch the bridges. They're all there.
translation.de: Wir haben die Brücken nicht angerührt.

translation.en: Relax, Spigliani.
The war for you is over.
translation.de: Der Krieg ist für Sie vorbei.

translation.en: You may even get to enjoy swimming in Charlestown again.
translation.de: Vielleicht schwimmen Sie wieder in Charlestown.

translation.en: But by this time tomorrow, your cowboy and Indian friends will all be dead.
translation.de: Aber morgen um diese Zeit sind Ihre Cowboy- und Indianerfreunde tot.

translation.en: The kid's looking at the photos on your gun.
translation.de: Der Junge schaut Ihr Foto an.

translation.en: My family.
[in Italian] Family. Do you understand?
[in English] Where's yours?
[in Italian] I have no family. Everyone is dead.
-Jesus. Does anybody here speak Italian? -Yeah.
translation.de: Spricht jemand Italienisch? Ja, ein bisschen.

translation.en: Yeah, I know a little.
-He says his name is… -[chuckles]
We, uh, we got that part.
[in English] He says his, um, mother and father died.
translation.de: Er sagt, seine Eltern sind tot.

translation.en: He's been living here with his grandfather. Till he died.
translation.de: Er lebte hier mit seinem Großvater, bis der starb.

translation.en: He's been hiding from the Germans for the last month.
translation.de: Er versteckt sich vor den Deutschen.

translation.en: We lost them, sir. They're using the rain to screen their movements.
translation.de: Wir haben sie verloren, Sir. Sie nutzen den Regen.

translation.en: Ask him if he knows where the Germans are.
translation.de: Weiß er, wo die Deutschen sind?

translation.en: He says he doesn't know.
He's lying.
Well, he's scared as shit, man.
-Jesus, Gomez, what did you do to him? -I didn't do anything.
translation.de: -Gomez, was soll das? -Ich habe nichts getan.

translation.en: -[laughing] -What the hell's so funny?
Ah, the Germans, man. They told him that first we were gonna feed him and then we were gonna do it to him.
translation.de: Die Deutschen haben ihm gesagt, dass wir ihm etwas antun würden.

translation.en: Do what? Cut off his nuts.
Hey, man, tell him we're not interested.
translation.de: Sag ihm, dass wir kein Interesse haben.

translation.en: -Tell him we already bagged our limit. -Tell him they're too small.
translation.de: Wir haben schon genug. Seine sind zu klein.

translation.en: Tell him it's a lie.
translation.de: Sag, dass es eine Lüge ist.

translation.en: Tell him the Germans aren't coming back. We guarantee it.
translation.de: Die Deutschen kommen nicht zurück. Das versprechen wir.

translation.en: Sir, are you sure you want me to tell him that?
translation.de: Sir, soll ich ihm das wirklich sagen?

translation.en: Tell him those men…
are the grandsons of the greatest Indian warriors to roam the American Plains.
translation.de: …sind Enkel großer indianischer Krieger der amerikanischen Prärie.

translation.en: They've killed mountain lion, hunted buffalo.
translation.de: Sie töteten Berglöwen und jagten Büffel.

translation.en: Tell him those men…
they're the descendants of the powerful Mexican army
that defeated the French on Cinco de Mayo.
translation.de: die am Cinco de Mayo die Franzosen besiegte.

translation.en: And those men…
they're sons of Texas Rangers…
who brought the rule of law to places where only killers and thieves lived before.
translation.de: …die an Orten voller Mörder und Diebe für Recht und Ordnung sorgten.

translation.en: Tell him the Nazis are never gonna hurt him again.
translation.de: Die Nazis werden ihm nie wieder etwas tun.

translation.en: Because tomorrow, we're gonna find 'em and stop 'em.
There now. Doesn't that feel better?
translation.de: Na, fühlt sich das nicht besser an?

translation.en: No man should have to walk around covering his privates.
translation.de: Keiner braucht Angst um seine Eier zu haben.

translation.en: He actually made the kid believe we could do it.
translation.de: Er hat dem Kind Zuversicht gegeben.

translation.en: Wasn't the kid he was convincing.
[Gomez] Sir?
A gift from our young friend.
It was his grandfather's. He wants you to have it.
translation.de: Sie gehörte seinem Großvater. Für Sie.

translation.en: I cut down the barrel to make it more practical.
He also told me where the Germans are.
translation.de: Er sagte, wo die Deutschen sind.

translation.en: -Be safe out there. -See ya, kid.
[in Italian] Thank you.
You're welcome.
Watch the grass in the middle.
[Sparks] It's not movin'.
Tank.
Panzer, two o'clock, 50 yards.
Let's go!
Come on!
Medic!
Get the Jeep.
Captain's been hit. -We need to take him to a field hospital. -Hold this.
translation.de: -Der Captain muss ins Feldlazarett. -Halten Sie das.

translation.en: [in Spanish] Hurry!
[in English] All right. Hang in there. Hang in there. Stay still. Come on!
translation.de: Halten Sie durch. Ruhig. Kommen Sie.

translation.en: -Get him outta here. Now! -Here we go. Come on. Get him up.
translation.de: -Weg mit ihm. -Los, wir heben ihn hoch.

translation.en: Easy. Easy.
Keep that up.
[Coldfoot] Stop!
Go! Go!
At ease, Lieutenant.
It's not Honolulu, is it?
Honolulu's overrated, sir.
Really?
Don't spoil my fantasy.
Finished a stint in Hawaii, then three years of college. Why'd you re-enlist?
translation.de: Dienst in Hawaii, dann drei Jahre College. Warum kamen Sie zurück?

translation.en: I ran out of money, sir.
Give the Army another couple of years, then go back and graduate.
translation.de: Noch ein paar Jahre in der Armee, dann machen Sie Ihren Abschluss?

translation.en: That's the plan, sir.
You did hear there might be a war on the horizon?
translation.de: Haben Sie gehört, dass ein Krieg droht?

translation.en: I caught wind of that, yes, sir.
If that happens, we're gonna need every good officer we can get our hands on.
translation.de: Wenn es so kommt, brauchen wir jeden guten Offizier.

translation.en: If that happens, I intend to be one of them, sir.
translation.de: Wenn es so kommt, bin ich dabei.

translation.en: What got you in the Army in the first place?
A sandwich, sir.
I had to leave home when I was 17.
Hunted all over the west for work, ended up skinny and starving in San Francisco.
translation.de: Ich suchte im Westen nach Arbeit und endete hungrig in San Francisco.

translation.en: Army recruiter bought me a meal, said that if I signed up, I'd get three just like it every day.
translation.de: Ein Rekrutierer kaufte mir eine Mahlzeit und versprach mir täglich drei.

translation.en: Your previous CO said you're good at handling problems.
translation.de: Ihr Vorgesetzter lobte Ihren Umgang mit Problemen.

translation.en: Well, I've got one. One of my companies, J Company,
translation.de: Ich habe eins. Die J-Company scheitert seit drei Monaten an Schussübungen.

translation.en: has failed every live fire test for the past three months.
translation.de: Die J-Company scheitert seit drei Monaten an Schussübungen.

translation.en: -Do you think you can shape them up? -Yes, sir.
translation.de: -Können Sie sie in Form bringen? -Ja, Sir.

translation.en: Good.
You've got one week.
-I'm looking for J Company. -Uh, over there.
[Gomez] Turn off that fucking gringo music.
-[music stops] -As you were, Corporal.
Who's in charge here?
-Um, Lt. Danalli, sir. -Lt. Danalli is now relieved.
My name is Sparks. I want a list of all prisoners and charges.
translation.de: Mein Name ist Sparks. Ich will eine Liste aller Häftlinge.

translation.en: Uh, right away, sir.
Follow me, sir.
Cordosa. Drunk and disorderly.
Assault and battery.
Gomez. Assaulting an officer.
Assaulting an officer.
We get a lot of that in here.
Why are the men segregated?
The Indians and the Mexicans don't like each other much.
translation.de: Indianer und Mexikaner mögen einander nicht.

translation.en: And they both hate us more.
Open the doors.
Sir? Open the doors, Corporal.
Clovis, New Mexico. There's a river down there, the Caheesh.
translation.de: Clovis, New Mexico. Da gibt es einen Fluss, den Caheesh.

translation.en: Fishing any good?
[in Spanish] Of course.
What's that?
[in English] Gila trout. It's the best in the world.
Wilsall, Montana. Sheep country.
What do you do about the wolves? We shoot 'em.
You any good at that?
I never miss.
Who the hell gave you that?
My brother.
Shit, I don't want you. I want him.
translation.de: Scheiße, dann hätte ich lieber ihn.

translation.en: My name is Lt. Sparks.
The fact that I'm talking to you in a jailhouse
tells me you didn't get on well with your previous COs.
translation.de: Offenbar kamen Sie nicht mit Vorgesetzten klar.

translation.en: Maybe you were told you're too stupid for this army.
translation.de: Sagt man, Sie wären zu dumm für die Armee?

translation.en: Maybe you were told you got a problem with authority or…
translation.de: Sagt man, Sie hätten ein Problem mit Autorität?

translation.en: maybe…
you were told you come from a race…
that's got no business wearing the uniform.
translation.de: hätte in Uniform nichts zu suchen.

translation.en: Whatever you've been told doesn't mean shit to me.
What matters to me… is performance.
There's a live fire test at the end of the week.
Pass it…
and you can enjoy a weekend of freedom.
Forty-eight hours, not only outside this cage…
but off-post.
But…
like everything else in life…
this privilege must be earned.
Now, if you feel that you and the US Army have reached the end of your journey together,
translation.de: Wenn Sie nicht länger den Weg der US Army beschreiten wollen,

translation.en: do not waste my time.
Or anybody else's.
But if you want the chance to prove that everything that every asshole ever said about you is wrong…
translation.de: Aber wenn Sie all die Arschlöcher Lügen strafen wollen…

translation.en: you got two minutes to lace up and join me outside.
translation.de: …treffen wir uns in zwei Minuten draußen.

translation.en: Shall we give them another minute, sir?
translation.de: Geben wir ihnen noch eine Minute?

translation.en: No.
It doesn't take another minute to figure this out.
Lock 'em back up.
Who's missing?
Only Coldfoot, sir.
All right, Corporal.
-Line 'em up. -Were you bullshitting me
translation.de: Ok, Corporal. In Reihe aufstellen. Können Sie uns tatsächlich von der Basis kriegen?

translation.en: or can you really get us off-post?
translation.de: Können Sie uns tatsächlich von der Basis kriegen?

translation.en: Only if the whole group passes.
[Sparks] J Company, attention!
[Sparks] Marks.
-What's the story with Coldfoot? -What story, sir?
He's been in the Army over three years. Why is he still a private?
translation.de: Nach dreieinhalb Jahren ist er noch Private.

translation.en: Coldfoot got demoted, sir.
He used to be corporal. Up for a promotion to sergeant.
translation.de: Er war Corporal und sollte Sergeant werden.

translation.en: What happened? He got turned down.
He blamed some NCOs, and it ended in a big fight.
translation.de: Daraufhin verprügelte er ein paar Unteroffiziere.

translation.en: The colonel… busted him down to private.
translation.de: Der Colonel degradierte ihn wieder zum Private.

translation.en: He got in a fight because he was denied promotion?
translation.de: Er prügelte, weil er nicht befördert wurde?

translation.en: It was his third rejection, sir.
Coldfoot is an Indian with pride, Lieutenant.
translation.de: Coldfoot ist ein stolzer Indianer, Lieutenant.

translation.en: It's… it's not a very "healthy combination around here.
translation.de: Das ist hier keine gute Kombination.

translation.en: [master sergeant] No wonder you feather-heads lost all your land.
translation.de: Kein Wunder, dass ihr Federköpfe all euer Land verloren habt.

translation.en: Here I thought it was 'cause you couldn't hold your liquor.
translation.de: Ich dachte, weil ihr keinen Alkohol vertragt.

translation.en: But all this time, it was 'cause you couldn't shoot worth a fuck.
translation.de: Aber es lag daran, dass ihr so beschissen schießt.

translation.en: What mojado taught you to fire a gun, Gomez?
translation.de: Welcher Mojado hat dir Schießen beigebracht, Gomez?

translation.en: Was it your melon-pickin' mother?
You got a problem with something, boy?
Well…
will you look who's back, boys?
translation.de: Wen haben wir denn da, Jungs?

translation.en: It's Corporal… [chuckles] …I mean, Private Chillyfoot.
I thought we got rid of you, prairie nigger.
translation.de: Ich dachte, wir wären dich los, Prärienigger.

translation.en: Trust me, it is just a matter of time--
translation.de: Glaub mir, es ist nur eine Frage der Zeit.

translation.en: Master Sergeant, can my men get a little more of your instruction
translation.de: Master Sergeant, bilden Sie meine Männer aus,

translation.en: and a little less of your commentary?
Beggin' your pardon, sir.
I forgot you're new around here.
See, this here is my firing range.
translation.de: Wissen Sie, das hier ist mein Schießstand.

translation.en: That means when your men step onto my range,
translation.de: Wenn Ihre Männer meinen Schießstand betreten,

translation.en: they become my men.
That's funny, Sergeant, 'cause the way I see it is…
when I bring my men onto your range…
translation.de: Wenn ich meine Männer zu Ihnen bringe,

translation.en: you become their instructor.
So far, all they've gotten from you is a dissertation on their diets
translation.de: Bislang hielten Sie nur Vorträge über Ernährung und sexuelle Vorlieben ihrer Mütter.

translation.en: and the sexual habits of their mothers, so…
translation.de: Vorträge über Ernährung und sexuelle Vorlieben ihrer Mütter.

translation.en: how about doing a little work?
See, now,
where I come from,
a man don't toss words around like that…
translation.de: redet ein Mann nur in diesem Ton,

translation.en: unless he's willing to back them up.
What goes on behind that shed stays behind that shed.
translation.de: Was hinterm Schuppen passiert, bleibt hinterm Schuppen.

translation.en: Very well, Sergeant.
Lead on.
You'd better start thinking how you're gonna explain these bruises, sir.
translation.de: Überlegen Sie schon mal, wie Sie Ihre blauen Flecken erklären.

translation.en: What bruises?
Fair warning, boys. You go back there, you'll have company.
translation.de: Eine Warnung: Da hinten kriegen Sie Gesellschaft.

translation.en: He still alive?
Barely.
Good.
I was wondering how I was gonna explain that.
Shall we pick up where we left off, gentlemen?
Attention!
Good work, Lieutenant.
-Best scores of any group. -Thank you, sir.
We credit the master sergeant with our success.
translation.de: Wir verdanken den Erfolg dem Master Sergeant.

translation.en: Excellent work, Master Sergeant. Sorry to hear about your little accident.
translation.de: Ausgezeichnet, Master Sergeant. Ihr Unfall tut mir leid.

translation.en: -Bring in the next group. -Yes, sir.
Come in.
There's a problem with Coldfoot. He's going into town.
-Yeah, he's got a pass. -It's where he's going that's a problem.
translation.de: -Ja, er hat einen Pass. -Es gibt ein Problem.

translation.en: [Sparks] Whatever you're planning…
don't.
They'll only call the MPs, have you thrown in jail.
translation.de: Man wird Sie nur wieder inhaftieren.

translation.en: What'll that prove? That nothing in this army leads to anything good.
translation.de: -Was beweist das? -Dass diese Armee zu nichts Gutem führt.

translation.en: That's not true.
What if I told you I'd put you up for sergeant this week?
No offense, Lieutenant, but I've been up for sergeant before.
translation.de: Ich sollte schon mal Sergeant werden.

translation.en: You wait and wait and then they give you an excuse and tell you no.
translation.de: Man wartet und wird schließlich abgelehnt.

translation.en: -I ain't waiting anymore. -You don't have to.
Get in the car, Sergeant Coldfoot.
[doctor] Is that your wife, Captain?
Yeah.
Lucky man.
On a lot of fronts.
The shrapnel went through your abdomen and sliced open your liver.
translation.de: Das Schrapnell hat Ihre Leber aufgeschlitzt.

translation.en: -You wanna tell me what the lucky part is? -You should be dead.
translation.de: -Wo ist da das Glück? -Sie sollten tot sein.

translation.en: Quick action by your men saved your life.
translation.de: Ihre Männer haben Ihr Leben gerettet.

translation.en: If you ever see them again, I suggest taking them out for a steak dinner.
translation.de: Sie sollten sie auf ein Steak einladen.

translation.en: Speaking of seeing them… when do I go back to Italy?
translation.de: Apropos, wann komme ich nach Italien zurück?

translation.en: Maybe after the war.
Your combat days are over, Captain.
Next stop for you is home.
Congratulations, Captain. You've got a million-dollar wound.
[narrator on newsreel] Italy,1944.
With winter setting in, the fighting south of Rome continues.
translation.de: Der Winter setzt ein. Südlich von Rom wird weiter gekämpft.

translation.en: Allied troops are dug in, waiting for the next German counterattack,
translation.de: Alliierte Truppen warten auf den nächsten deutschen Gegenangriff,

translation.en: which is expected any day.
translation.de: mit dem täglich zu rechnen ist.

translation.en: The going is tough, but so are our boys.
translation.de: Die Zeiten sind hart, aber unsere Jungs auch.

translation.en: Ask any one of them and they'll tell you
it'll take a lot more than a little rain and mud
translation.de: dass ein wenig Regen und Schlamm

translation.en: to get these GI Joes down.
I need transportation, Captain. I'm not that damn particular. You'll do.
translation.de: Ich brauche einen Fahrer, Captain, und Sie reichen mir.

translation.en: Okay, now that you've seen it…
I'm thirsty. Let's get a drink.
It happened a week after you were wounded.
My Jeep hit a mine.
translation.de: fuhr mein Jeep über eine Mine.

translation.en: It threw me 20 feet in the air, took off everything below the knee.
translation.de: Ich flog sechs Meter hoch und verlor alles unterm Knie.

translation.en: Congratulations on your stars, sir.
Thank you.
Truth is, Felix… in this war, getting promoted is easy.
translation.de: Felix, in diesem Krieg ist es leicht, befördert zu werden.

translation.en: The hard part is staying alive.
Any news on the 157?
They're stuck on the Gustav Line south of Cassino.
translation.de: Sie stecken an der Gustav-Linie bei Cassino fest.

translation.en: It's cold, wet and shitty. They're hangin' tough.
translation.de: Es ist kalt, nass und beschissen. Aber sie sind zäh.

translation.en: Who'd you send in for me?
He's a good soldier.
He's not you, but he's okay.
[sighs] When are they, uh, sending you home, sir?
Next week.
I was going to offer to take any letters back for you,
but I hear that won't be necessary.
translation.de: aber das ist wohl nicht nötig.

translation.en: You're right after me.
Yeah.
Don't act excited or anything.
I know this sounds crazy.
I feel I should be in Italy. I oughta be with my men.
translation.de: Ich sollte in Italien bei meinen Männern sein.

translation.en: Go home, Felix. Go home to Mary.
translation.de: Gehen Sie nach Hause, Felix, zu Mary.

translation.en: See your son, raise more babies.
translation.de: Seien Sie bei Ihrem Sohn, kriegen Sie mehr Babys.

translation.en: You've done your duty.
Safe travels, sir. See you back home, Felix.
translation.de: -Gute Reise, Sir. -Wir sehen uns in der Heimat.

translation.en: [Sparks] My dearest Mary…
I've never been a good letter writer, so I don't know if I can explain this.
translation.de: Ich konnte nie gut schreiben und weiß nicht, ob ich es erklären kann.

translation.en: Hell, I'm not sure I can explain it even to myself.
translation.de: Ich kann es mir selbst kaum erklären.

translation.en: When I left you to come over here, I was scared of losing you.
translation.de: Als ich hierherkam, hatte ich Angst, dich zu verlieren.

translation.en: Scared of not coming back.
Scared of dying.
I'm not scared anymore.
[man] Sir?
There's an Army captain out there.
translation.de: Da draußen steht ein Army Captain.

translation.en: He wants to hitch a ride back to Italy.
[Sparks] I guess the only way to explain my decision
translation.de: Ich kann es nur so erklären:

translation.en: is that it isn't my time to come home yet.
Captain, what are you doing?
What's it look like I'm doing, Doc?
You're not ready for discharge.
You walk out of here, Captain, you'll be AWOL.
translation.de: -Sie dürfen nicht gehen. -Pass auf dich auf.

translation.en: -[Sparks] Take care, kid. -Captain!
translation.de: -Sie dürfen nicht gehen. -Pass auf dich auf. Captain!

translation.en: [Sparks] I know you want me home. Make no mistake, I wanna be home.
translation.de: Du willst, dass ich komme, und ich will es auch.

translation.en: Desperately.
I wanna hold my son in my arms
and lay with you on a quiet desert night beneath the stars.
translation.de: und mit dir die Sterne am Wüstenhimmel betrachten.

translation.en: But I owe something to a group of men.
translation.de: Aber ich bin meinen Männern etwas schuldig.

translation.en: Men who… before the war…
translation.de: Diese Männer hätte ich vor dem Krieg

translation.en: I'd probably never have known,
and now I know as well as I know myself.
translation.de: Jetzt kenne ich sie so gut wie mich selbst.

translation.en: If I came home, I could never live with myself, knowing I owed a debt to them and ignored it.
translation.de: Ich kann meine Pflicht ihnen gegenüber nicht ignorieren.

translation.en: So I have to complete this journey I've started.
translation.de: Also muss ich diesen Weg zu Ende gehen.

translation.en: I cannot quit.
Anything less would leave a hole in my conscience that I could never repair.
translation.de: So ein Loch in meinem Gewissen könnte ich niemals kitten.

translation.en: Capt. Sparks, 157th Regiment, 2nd Battalion.
Orders, Captain.
I was just released from a hospital in North Africa, sir.
translation.de: Ich komme gerade aus dem Krankenhaus

translation.en: I was hoping to be reassigned to my old company.
translation.de: und will zu meiner alten Einheit.

translation.en: What happened to your orders, Captain?
I didn't like 'em, sir. They were to send me home.
translation.de: Sie gefielen mir nicht. Sie schickten mich nach Hause.

translation.en: Mary, I don't expect you to understand.
translation.de: Ich erwarte nicht, dass du es verstehst.

translation.en: I'm having a hard time understanding it myself.
But I have never been more sure of anything in my life
translation.de: Aber ich war mir im Leben noch nie so sicher

translation.en: and I have to trust that.
So, please…
my darling Mary…
my dearest wife…
forgive me.
Get back to your foxhole, soldier. That's an order.
translation.de: Zurück ins Loch! Das ist ein Befehl!

translation.en: Dios mio, it's the captain.
What are you looking at, Sergeant?
-[gun cocks] -Give me your report.
♪ Just before the sunrise ♪
